expected_issues.description: Male patient billed for obstetric ultrasound (CPT 76805) - anatomically impossible

detected_issues.summary: The patient is male but received an obstetric ultrasound (CPT 76805). This procedure is not medically appropriate for a male patient.
detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 lists CPT 76805 - Obstetric Ultrasound, Single/First Gestation. Patient profile indicates the patient is male.

expected_issues.description: 72-year-old post-menopausal female billed for IUD insertion (CPT 58300) - clinically inappropriate

detected_issues.summary: IUD insertion performed on a 72-year-old female. IUDs are typically used for contraception and are less common in post-menopausal women.
detected_issues.evidence: CPT 58300 - Insertion of Intrauterine Device (IUD) on a 72-year-old female patient.

expected_issues.description: 8-year-old child billed for colonoscopy (CPT 45378) - not age-appropriate screening

detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 includes CPT 45378 - Colonoscopy, Diagnostic, performed on an 8-year-old male patient. Colonoscopies are not routinely performed on children unless there are specific medical indications, which are not mentioned in the provided medical history.

detected_issues.summary: Preventive visit and diagnostic colonoscopy on the same day.
detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 includes CPT 99392 (Preventive Visit) and CPT 45378 (Colonoscopy, Diagnostic) with the same date of service (01/22/2026). The combination of a routine preventive visit and a diagnostic colonoscopy on the same day is unusual for a child and warrants further investigation.

expected_issues.description: Female patient billed for prostate exam (CPT 55700) - anatomically impossible

detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 lists CPT 55700 - Biopsy, Prostate; Needle or Punch. Patient is female.

detected_issues.summary: Discrepancy in amount due for Office Visit (CPT 99214).
detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 shows $185.00 due for CPT 99214. Document 2 shows a patient responsibility of $28.00 for the same service.

expected_issues.description: Male patient billed for hysterectomy (CPT 58150) - anatomically impossible

detected_issues.evidence: Patient profile indicates male gender. Document 1 lists CPT 58150 - Total Abdominal Hysterectomy.

expected_issues.description: 15-year-old billed for screening mammogram (CPT 77067) - not recommended before age 40

detected_issues.summary: Screening mammography performed on a 15-year-old female.
detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 lists CPT 77067 - Screening Mammography, Bilateral - for a 15-year-old female. Screening mammography is generally not recommended for patients under 40 without specific risk factors.

expected_issues.description: Male patient billed for cervical biopsy (CPT 57500) - anatomically impossible

detected_issues.summary: CPT 57500 (Biopsy of Cervix) was billed for a male patient.
detected_issues.evidence: The patient is male (Sex: M) and CPT 57500 is a procedure performed on the cervix, a female anatomical structure.

expected_issues.description: 3-year-old toddler billed for stress cardiac test (CPT 93015) - not age-appropriate

detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 lists CPT 93015 - Cardiovascular Stress Test, Complete - for a 3-year-old patient (DOB 2022-05-20). Cardiovascular stress tests are not routinely performed on young children unless there is a very specific and unusual medical indication, which is not mentioned in the provided medical history.

detected_issues.summary: Discrepancy in total patient responsibility between documents.
detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 states a current amount due of $385.00. Document 2 (Medicare EOB) states patient responsibility is $36.00.
